meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk was imboldening the team before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The hero's speech was imboldening the villagers to stand up against the dragon.
meanings.sent3: The imboldening music in the movie made the audience feel like they could conquer anything.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun imboldened the flowers to bloom brightly in the morning light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouraging words were imboldening the students to try their best.

meanings.definition: To give confidence or courage to.
meanings.sent1: The supportive friend was imboldening Sarah to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: The success stories were imboldening the new entrepreneurs to take risks.
meanings.sent3: The imboldening cheers from the crowd motivated the team to push harder.
meanings.sent4: The majestic view from the mountaintop imboldened the hikers to continue their journey.
meanings.sent5: The kind words from the mentor were imboldening the mentee to pursue their dreams.
